title: Wealth Enhancement Advisory Services LLC Sells 20,578 Shares of Lam Research Corporation $LRCX
summary: Wealth Enhancement Advisory Services LLC reduced its stake in Lam Research Corporation by 6.4%, selling 20,578 shares and now owning 300,913 shares valued at approximately $42.233 million. Despite insider selling, institutional investors hold a significant 84.61% of the semiconductor company's stock, which recently beat earnings estimates. Analysts currently rate LRCX a "Moderate Buy" with an average price target of $196.33.

title: Why Astera Labs Wins AI’s Bottleneck (NASDAQ:ALAB)
summary: Astera Labs (ALAB) is positioned to benefit from the growing bottlenecks in AI infrastructure, specifically connectivity and power efficiency, as highlighted at CES 2026. The company's focus on photonics and interconnect strategies aligns with industry trends such as Nvidia's Rubin platform and AMD's Helios architecture. While ALAB stock trades at a high forward P/E, successful execution of its upcoming projects could justify its valuation through significant revenue growth.

title: Cadence's new audio DSP boosts AI speed 8X, cuts power 25%
summary: Cadence (Nasdaq: CDNS) has launched its Tensilica HiFi iQ DSP IP, a sixth-generation digital signal processor built for next-generation voice AI and immersive audio applications. This new architecture offers 2X greater compute performance, 8X higher AI performance, and over 25% energy savings compared to its predecessor, the Tensilica HiFi 5s DSP. The HiFi iQ DSP aims to meet the increasing computational demands of home entertainment, automotive infotainment, and smartphone markets, supporting advanced codecs and enabling seamless natural language processing and on-device AI.

title: Nvidia, Broadcom, Micron among JPMorgan's favorite chip stocks going into earnings (NVDA:NASDAQ)
summary: J.P. Morgan has named Nvidia, Broadcom, and Micron as its top semiconductor stock picks ahead of the coming earnings season. The investment bank anticipates that companies will report strong results for Q4 2025 and provide optimistic guidance. J.P. Morgan also foresees significant growth in the AI accelerator market and a general industry revenue increase of over 15% for the year, driven by market recovery and lean inventories.

title: Fortinet price target lowered to $88 from $95 at Truist
summary: Truist has lowered its price target for Fortinet (FTNT) to $88 from $95, while maintaining a Buy rating on the shares. This adjustment comes as part of a broader research note previewing the fourth quarter for cybersecurity companies. The firm anticipates strong Q4 reports and a conservative guidance approach, noting that market pressure has shifted toward AI hardware despite continued momentum in Security & AI initiatives.

title: Universal Beteiligungs und Servicegesellschaft mbH Acquires 45,281 Shares of Texas Instruments Incorporated $TXN
summary: Universal Beteiligungs und Servicegesellschaft mbH increased its stake in Texas Instruments by 5.8%, acquiring an additional 45,281 shares. This brings their total holdings to 831,597 shares, valued at $152.7 million. Other institutional investors also adjusted their positions, while analysts issued varied price targets and ratings for the semiconductor company.

title: Vest Financial LLC Sells 50,534 Shares of Caterpillar Inc. $CAT
summary: Vest Financial LLC decreased its stake in Caterpillar Inc. by 26.5% during the third quarter, selling 50,534 shares. Despite this, other hedge funds increased their holdings in Caterpillar, and institutional investors collectively own 70.98% of the company's stock. Insider selling by CFO Andrew R. J. Bonfield and insider Lange Bob De was also reported, though analysts generally maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for Caterpillar with an average price target of $625.85.

title: Middleton & Co. Inc. MA Buys 2,089 Shares of Synopsys, Inc. $SNPS
summary: Middleton & Co. Inc. MA increased its stake in Synopsys, Inc. (NASDAQ:SNPS) by 10.6% during the third quarter, purchasing an additional 2,089 shares and bringing its total holdings to 21,712 shares valued at $10.712 million. While institutional investors own a significant portion of the company, recent insider selling by CFO Shelagh Glaser and insider Janet Lee has been noted. Analyst ratings for Synopsys are mixed, with a "Hold" consensus and an average price target of $553.57, although the company recently surpassed quarterly EPS expectations and provided optimistic FY2026 guidance.

title: Nvidia CEO Says AI Will Create Jobs For Electricians and Plumbers
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang believes that artificial intelligence will create new job opportunities, particularly for skilled vocational workers such as electricians, plumbers, and construction workers. He states that the demand for building data centers to run and train AI will lead to "six-figure salaries" for these professions, emphasizing that AI will necessitate one of the largest infrastructure buildouts in history. Huang made these remarks during an interview with BlackRock Inc. CEO Larry Fink at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

title: 2 Reasons to Watch ELV and 1 to Stay Cautious
summary: Elevance Health (ELV) has shown strong performance due to its size, which provides economies of scale and negotiating leverage, and its excellent 27.7% five-year average ROIC. However, a significant concern is its declining customer base, which has seen a 2.2% year-on-year decrease over the past two years, indicating potential product or sales weaknesses. Despite the customer decline, the article suggests ELV's positive attributes currently outweigh the negatives, making it a stock to consider.

title: Why Investors Shouldn't Be Surprised By Sprott Inc.'s (TSE:SII) 27% Share Price Surge
summary: Sprott Inc. (TSE:SII) shares have recently surged by 27% over the last month, contributing to a 176% increase over the past year. Despite its high P/E ratio of 63.3x compared to the Canadian market average, this is largely attributed to its impressive earnings per share growth of 138% over the last three years, which significantly outperforms the broader market forecast. Investors appear willing to pay a premium for Sprott due to its strong growth trajectory.

title: UBS reiterates Buy rating on 3M stock with $190 price target
summary: UBS has maintained its Buy rating and $190.00 price target for 3M (NYSE:MMM) despite the stock's 8% drop after fourth-quarter results narrowly missed expectations. The firm attributes the stock's decline to multiple contraction rather than revised 2026 expectations, viewing the current sell-off as a "compelling buying opportunity." 3M's strong dividend history and anticipated volume and productivity benefits in 2026 support UBS's positive outlook.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA Stock Holdings Increased by CoreCap Advisors LLC
summary: CoreCap Advisors LLC increased its holdings in NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) by 4.1% in the third quarter, making it their 8th largest holding. This increase comes despite recent heavy insider selling, with top executives offloading shares worth millions. NVIDIA continues to report strong financial results, with significant revenue growth and positive analyst consensus for a "Moderate Buy" rating, though some negative sentiments like China export uncertainty and macro risks persist.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA Shares Acquired by Code Waechter LLC
summary: Code Waechter LLC significantly increased its stake in NVIDIA (NVDA) by 59.0% in Q3 2025, now holding 7,853 shares valued at approximately $1.414 million. This makes NVIDIA its 20th-largest holding. Despite general positive sentiment from Wall Street analysts with an average "Moderate Buy" rating, the company faces near-term challenges such as China export uncertainties and notable insider selling.

title: Does McKesson’s (MCK) Expanded Oncology Data Role Quietly Reshape Its Long-Term Healthcare Moat?
summary: McKesson's expanded role in oncology data, evidenced by its continued recognition as a Qualified Clinical Data Registry by CMS and the inclusion of its oncology quality measures, is significantly enhancing its long-term healthcare moat. While new drug distribution deals are incremental, the strategic embedding into clinical workflows and data infrastructure solidifies McKesson's position. This strategic depth in data and reporting is becoming a key differentiator, influencing its investment narrative beyond its core distribution business.

title: Serve Robotics Acquires Diligent Robotics for $29 Million, Enters Healthcare Sector
summary: Serve Robotics has acquired Diligent Robotics for $29 million, marking its entry into the healthcare sector. This move, however, led to a nearly 10% drop in Serve's stock due to investor concerns about its profitability. Despite short-term market apprehension, some community members remain optimistic about the long-term prospects and value creation the acquisition could bring, especially given Diligent's successful Moxi robot deployments in hospitals.

title: Fortinet (FTNT) Valuation Revisited As Recent Share Price Weakness Contrasts With Long Term Gains
summary: Fortinet (FTNT) is experiencing a period of recent share price weakness despite strong long-term gains, prompting investors to re-evaluate its valuation. The company trades at a P/E of 30x, which is considered undervalued compared to its peers and the broader US software industry, and its discounted cash flow model suggests a potential upside of 27%. While recent performance raises some watchpoints, the fundamental analysis indicates Fortinet could be a good value investment.

title: Astera Labs (ALAB) Valuation Check After RBC Coverage And Retimer Growth Outlook
summary: Astera Labs (ALAB) is under scrutiny after RBC Capital initiated coverage, highlighting strong demand for retimers and upcoming product launches. Despite a substantial increase in share price and projected revenue growth, the stock appears overvalued with a Price-to-Sales ratio of 42.9x compared to an industry average of 5.7x, and a DCF model also indicating rich pricing. Investors are advised to consider risks like reliance on hyperscalers and potential competition in connectivity solutions.

title: Datavault AI (DVLT) Valuation Check After Prolonged Share Price Weakness
summary: Datavault AI (DVLT) has experienced prolonged share price weakness, with negative returns over the past month and three months. Despite this, Simply Wall St suggests a significant undervaluation, with a narrative fair value of US$4.00 against the current price of US$0.71, predicated on aggressive future growth and profitability assumptions through new proprietary data exchange platforms. The analysis highlights an "undervalued" result but also points to clear pressure points like revenue recognition risk and dependence on key partnerships.

title: Nvidia’s Huang Plans to Visit China as He Works to Reopen Market
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang is scheduled to travel to China in late January to attend company parties in anticipation of the Lunar New Year. His visit is aimed at reinvigorating the significant Chinese market for Nvidia's AI chips, though it remains uncertain if he will meet with high-ranking Chinese officials. Huang's itinerary is subject to change based on prospective meeting confirmations.

title: I Predicted Nvidia Would Be a $5 Trillion Company in 2025. Here's Why I Was Right (and Wrong).
summary: An analyst predicted Nvidia would reach a $5 trillion market cap in 2025 due to rapid AI hyperscaler spending, which largely held true as Nvidia briefly hit that valuation. While the company's market cap fluctuated, its stock valuation became slightly cheaper than expected. The analyst now projects Nvidia to solidly remain in the $5 trillion club by the end of 2026, driven by continued high demand for its GPUs and strong revenue growth.

title: Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOG) Stock Price Down 2.5% - Here's What Happened
summary: Alphabet's (NASDAQ:GOOG) stock fell 2.5% to $322.16 on Tuesday with higher-than-average trading volume. Key drivers include increasing demand for its Gemini AI models and recent positive analyst price target revisions, despite a broader tech selloff and significant insider selling. The company reported strong Q3 earnings and issued a quarterly dividend.

title: Assessing Take-Two Interactive Software (TTWO) Valuation As Recent Share Price Momentum Softens
summary: This article examines the valuation of Take-Two Interactive Software (TTWO) as its recent share price momentum has softened despite strong multi-year returns. While one narrative suggests the stock is 13.3% undervalued with a fair value of US$277.40 based on strong growth forecasts and a robust release slate, another view argues that the market pricing looks full with a P/S ratio significantly above the industry average. The analysis highlights the importance of upcoming game releases like Grand Theft Auto and NBA 2K, and managing development costs, for the company to meet future expectations.

title: Is Costco Stock a Long-Term Buy for Everyday Investors?​
summary: Costco (COST) shows strong comparable sales growth, particularly in international markets and e-commerce, making it a reliable company. However, the article suggests that its high valuation (P/E ratio above 50) and moderate net income growth (11.3% year-over-year) might limit significant upside for growth investors. While suitable for conservative investors, those seeking higher returns might consider other options, particularly in high-growth sectors like AI.

title: AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV) Stock Price Down 15.8% - What's Next?
summary: AeroVironment (NASDAQ:AVAV) experienced a significant 15.8% stock price drop after missing Q2 EPS estimates, reporting $0.44 against an expected $0.87, despite strong revenue growth and setting FY2026 guidance. Analysts generally maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average price target of $375.41. Insider selling activity was noted, while institutional investors hold a substantial majority of the shares.

title: 3 Reasons to Avoid DHR and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article suggests investors avoid Danaher (DHR) despite its recent market outperformance, citing three main reasons: declining organic revenue in its core business, a dropping free cash flow margin, and decreasing return on invested capital (ROIC). The author recommends looking at other companies with superior fundamentals instead, highlighting StockStory's "Top 5 Strong Momentum Stocks" for potential growth.

title: Arthur J. Gallagher (AJG): 3 Reasons We Love This Stock
summary: Despite a recent 16.6% stock price decline over the past six months, Arthur J. Gallagher (AJG) presents a compelling investment opportunity. The company demonstrates strong fundamentals, including exceptional five-year compounded annual revenue growth of 14.6%, robust EPS growth of 18.7%, and an excellent average free cash flow margin of 18.6%. These factors suggest AJG is a high-quality business, making its current trading valuation of 20.1x forward P/E potentially attractive following the recent pullback.

title: Dycom (DY): 3 Reasons We Love This Stock
summary: Dycom Industries (DY) has seen significant stock price growth, up 42.7% in the last six months, driven by solid quarterly results. The company demonstrates strong long-term revenue growth, increasing operating margins, and outstanding long-term EPS growth, making it a high-quality business despite its current trading valuation of 29 times forward P/E.

title: Earlyworks Closes Acquisition and Rebrands as Perpetuals.com (NASDAQ – PDC), Targeting the Multi-Trillion-Dollar Global Derivatives Market
summary: Earlyworks Co., Ltd. has completed its acquisition of Perpetual Markets Ltd. and rebranded as Perpetuals.com Ltd., with its Nasdaq ticker changing to PDC. The company aims to bridge traditional financial markets with blockchain-based crypto markets using its Kronos X® exchange software suite, targeting the multi-trillion-dollar global derivatives market. Perpetuals.com also plans to disrupt existing derivatives markets with AI-enhanced products and operate its own Multilateral Trading Facilities in Europe.

title: Richard Hayne Sells 10,667 Shares of Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) Stock
summary: Richard Hayne, CEO of Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN), recently sold 10,667 shares of the company's stock for approximately $748,823, reducing his stake by 0.06%. The transaction, dated January 16th, occurred at an average price of $70.20 per share, with Hayne still owning over 17.6 million shares valued at about $1.239 billion. Analysts currently maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for Urban Outfitters, with an average price target of $86.67.

title: Credo Technology Group (NASDAQ:CRDO) CTO Sells 30,000 Shares
summary: Credo Technology Group's CTO, Chi Fung Cheng, sold 30,000 shares of the company's stock on January 15th for over $4.6 million, reducing his position by 0.47%. This recent sale is part of a series of transactions since October, totaling 365,000 shares and generating approximately $55.5 million. Despite the insider selling, Credo Technology Group reported strong quarterly earnings, and analysts maintain a consensus "Buy" rating with a target price of $220.42.

title: A Global Equity Staple: Analyzing the iShares MSCI World ETF
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) is performing well in a favorable macroeconomic climate, primarily driven by its heavy concentration in U.S. technology stocks, especially those related to AI. URTH tracks large and mid-cap companies across 23 developed nations, with over 69% of its assets in the U.S., making its performance closely tied to American mega-cap stocks. Despite competition from lower-cost Vanguard funds, its physical replication strategy and significant tech tilt remain key characteristics that will be influenced by central bank rate cuts and upcoming index rebalancing.

title: Amkor Technology (NASDAQ:AMKR) Director Guillaume Marie Jean Rutten Sells 10,000 Shares
summary: Amkor Technology (NASDAQ:AMKR) Director Guillaume Marie Jean Rutten sold 10,000 shares of the company's stock on January 15th for over $531,000, reducing his holding by 2.90%. This transaction follows a previous sale in November. The company recently reported strong quarterly earnings, exceeding analyst estimates, and increased its quarterly dividend.

title: Lumentum Holds Strong Amid Market Rally
summary: Lumentum Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: LITE) has seen its stock price rise by 10.05% due to strong market confidence and investor optimism. The company is gaining recognition in the AI infrastructure sector, with analysts like Needham and Barclays significantly raising their price targets. Lumentum's innovative solutions in laser technology and its increasing AI-related revenue are key drivers of its positive market performance.

title: Envirotech Vehicles receives Nasdaq notice for delayed annual meeting
summary: Envirotech Vehicles (NASDAQ:EVTV) has received a notice from Nasdaq for non-compliance due to delaying its annual meeting of stockholders past the required timeframe. The company, which has seen significant stock surge year-to-date despite a yearly drop and currently burns cash, must submit a compliance plan by March 2. Amidst these challenges, Envirotech Vehicles is also proceeding with a potential $480 million merger with AZIO AI Corporation, transforming it into an AI infrastructure platform.

title: RBC Initiates Astera Labs (ALAB) at Outperform, Sees Retimer Growth and Scorpio Ramp Driving Upside
summary: RBC Capital analyst Srini Pajjuri initiated coverage of Astera Labs (ALAB) with an Outperform rating and a $225 price target, citing strong retimer growth and the Scorpio-P switch ramp as drivers for near-term strength. Despite recent underperformance linked to concerns about next-gen networking standards and Google TPU, Astera Labs' fundamentals remain robust. The analyst believes a premium valuation is justified by the company's 40% growth, a $10–15 billion serviceable addressable market, and over 70% gross margins, anticipating future opportunities, including participation in Ethernet/ESU standards.

title: Aeva wins first defense contract to supply lidar for autonomous vehicles
summary: Aeva Technologies, Inc. has secured its first defense contract to supply 4D LiDAR sensors and perception technology to Forterra for autonomous defense vehicles. This move validates Aeva's technology platform for demanding autonomous missions and follows the company's recent advancements in high-power optical amplifiers for AI data centers and the introduction of its Omni 4D LiDAR sensor for physical AI applications.

title: RBC Initiates Intel (INTC) at Sector Perform, Awaits Proof on Margins and Foundry Execution
summary: RBC Capital has initiated coverage on Intel (INTC) with a "Sector Perform" rating and a $50 price target. Analysts acknowledge Intel's strategic progress, including a strengthened balance sheet and improved PC/Server demand, but are awaiting concrete evidence of gross margin improvements and successful foundry execution before adopting a more optimistic stance. They also cautioned about potential impacts from higher memory prices and supply constraints, and a lack of a strong Data Center AI narrative.

title: Citi's Top Semiconductor Picks: Nvidia, Broadcom, NXP, and Analog Devices Ahead of Earnings Season
summary: Citi analyst Atif Malik expects a strong semiconductor earnings season, with a focus on data center chips like Broadcom (AVGO) and Nvidia (NVDA) due to AI and general-purpose server demand. The firm also favors Analog Devices (ADI) and NXP Semiconductors (NXPI) as the analog market recovers, while expressing caution regarding Qualcomm (QCOM) due to Apple's modem business loss. The article also includes analyst ratings and price targets for Apple (AAPL), detailing various analyst views and target adjustments.

title: Lumentum (NASDAQ:LITE) Shares Up 7.2% - What's Next?
summary: Lumentum (NASDAQ:LITE) shares rose 7.2% mid-day on Tuesday, trading at $347.52 on lower-than-average volume. The company recently exceeded EPS and revenue expectations, and some analysts have raised their price targets despite a "Moderate Buy" consensus and high P/E ratio. Insider selling was also noted in the last quarter.

title: Pegasystems and Cadence Design Systems Shares Are Falling, What You Need To Know
summary: Pegasystems (NASDAQ:PEGA) and Cadence Design Systems (NASDAQ:CDNS) saw their shares fall due to escalating geopolitical tensions between the United States and the European Union, specifically over Greenland, which sparked fears of a renewed trade war. This led to a "risk-off" environment in the broader market, with investors moving towards safe-haven assets. Cadence Design Systems' stock also experienced a previous drop linked to concerns about a semiconductor sell-off and a fragmented global order impacting tech giants.

title: Thermo Fisher Scientific and NVIDIA Partner to Advance Laboratory AI Automation
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific and NVIDIA have announced a strategic collaboration to integrate artificial intelligence into scientific instrumentation and laboratory infrastructure. This partnership aims to accelerate automation, improve accuracy, and connect laboratory data to scalable AI systems, driving a shift towards "lab-in-the-loop" science. The initiative will leverage NVIDIA's AI infrastructure, including supercomputers and foundation models, to enable real-time data analysis and AI-assisted experimental design.

title: BofA Analysts Highlight Uber’s (UBER) Autonomous Vehicle Potential
summary: BofA Securities has reaffirmed its "Buy" rating for Uber Technologies (UBER), citing the company's strong position in the autonomous vehicle (AV) sector and its crucial partnership with NVIDIA for Level 4 AV deployment. BofA believes increased production of Level 4 AVs by manufacturers would present significant opportunities for Uber's network and enable consumers to monetize their AVs through the platform. Conversely, Melius Research downgraded UBER to "Sell" due to concerns about rising competition in the AV industry potentially impacting Uber's market share and returns, despite its partnership strategy.

title: Nova (NVMI) Stock Is Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of Nova (NVMI) rose 3.3% after Needham upgraded the stock to 'Buy' with a $500 price target, citing Nova's strong global execution and potential benefits from China's memory wafer fabrication equipment market in 2026. The increase followed broader optimism in the semiconductor sector, fueled by Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.'s strong quarterly results and robust demand for AI hardware. Nova's stock has seen significant gains year-to-date, reaching a new 52-week high.

title: 3M, NVIDIA Corp. share losses lead Dow's 611-point drop
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 611 points, primarily driven by significant share losses in 3M and NVIDIA Corp. This decline reflects broader market movements influenced by these key companies.

title: Has Alphabet Stock Hit Its Top at $4 Trillion?
summary: Alphabet (GOOGL) recently reached a $4 trillion market cap, following Nvidia (NVDA) and signing a partnership with Apple (AAPL) for AI technology. However, GOOGL experienced losses after hitting this peak, a pattern observed with other megacaps like Apple and Nvidia, suggesting a "hangover" effect. While short-term pullbacks are common after reaching such significant market cap milestones, historical data indicates a positive long-term outlook for these stocks, with most beating the S&P 500 over a year.

title: These Stocks Are Today’s Movers: Nvidia, Netflix, Intel, Sandisk, 3M, Coinbase, Newmont, RAPT, Fastenal, and More
summary: Stocks, including major tech companies like Nvidia, Netflix, and Intel, experienced a downturn on Tuesday. The market's decline was attributed to investor concerns over President Donald Trump’s proposal to impose tariffs on eight NATO countries. These tariffs are reportedly a tactic to pressure the countries into allowing the U.S. administration to acquire Greenland.

title: Nvidia's Gain, Your Loss: Micron Confirms 100% Sell-Through to AI Leaders
summary: Micron Technology's Executive VP Manish Bhatia confirmed an "unprecedented" shortage of memory chips due to the AI infrastructure boom, impacting the availability of components for consumer electronics. To address the soaring demand from AI titans like Nvidia and Microsoft, Micron is prioritizing these enterprise giants, even discontinuing its consumer memory business. While a $100 billion domestic production site in New York is planned for the long term, Micron is also acquiring a plant in Taiwan to accelerate DRAM output by 2027 to meet immediate needs, indicating that consumers will face higher prices and lower availability of conventional tech components.

title: Envirotech Vehicles’ Stock Skyrockets as AZIO AI Partnership Blossoms
summary: Envirotech Vehicles Inc.'s stock surged by 7.61% following AZIO AI's announcement of a significant order for Nvidia GPUs, projecting $107M in revenue. This partnership, which involves AZIO AI becoming a wholly-owned subsidiary, reflects a strategic shift for Envirotech into AI-centric markets and has dramatically boosted investor confidence. The move aims to revolutionize Envirotech’s offerings and foster growth despite previous financial hurdles.

title: The Labor Lens: Why the Upcoming ADP Jobs Report is the Deciding Factor for the Fed’s Next Move
summary: The upcoming February ADP National Employment Report is critical for determining the Federal Reserve's next monetary policy move, with investors closely watching the data's impact under the new One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA) and AI-driven economic landscape. A weak report could validate "intentional cooling" and prompt further rate cuts, while a strong one might reignite inflation fears and force the Fed to maintain a "higher-for-longer" stance. The report will shape strategies across technology, finance, and housing, revealing if the U.S. can achieve a soft landing amidst evolving productivity-driven growth.
